Package choreo.auto

Class AutoLoop

java.lang.Object
choreo.auto.AutoLoop
public class AutoLoop extends Object
A loop that represents an autonomous routine.

This loop is used to handle autonomous trigger logic and schedule commands. This loop should **not** be shared across multiple autonomous routines.

  • Field Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    protected boolean
    isActive
    A boolean utilized in enabled() to resolve trueness

    isKilled

    protected final EventLoop
    loop
    The underlying EventLoop that triggers are bound to and polled
    protected final String
    name
    The name of the auto routine this loop is associated with

  • Constructor Details

    • AutoLoop

      public AutoLoop(String name)
      Creates a new loop with a specific name
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the loop
      See Also:
      • Creating a loop from a AutoFactory

    • AutoLoop

      protected AutoLoop(String name, EventLoop loop)
      A constructor to be used when inhereting this class to instantiate a custom inner loop
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the loop
      loop - The inner EventLoop

  • Method Details

    • enabled

      public Trigger enabled()
      Returns a Trigger that is true while this autonomous loop is being polled.

      Using a Trigger.onFalse(Command) will do nothing as when this is false the loop is not being polled anymore.

      Returns:
      A Trigger that is true while this autonomous loop is being polled.

    • poll

      public void poll()
      Polls the loop. Should be called in the autonomous periodic method.

    • getLoop

      public EventLoop getLoop()
      Gets the event loop that this loop is using.
      Returns:
      The event loop that this loop is using.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the loop. This can either be called on auto init or auto end to reset the loop incase you run it again. If this is called on a loop that doesn't need to be reset it will do nothing.

    • kill

      public void kill()
      Kills the loop and prevents it from running again.

    • cmd

      public Command cmd()
      Creates a command that will poll this event loop and reset it when it is cancelled.
      Returns:
      A command that will poll this event loop and reset it when it is cancelled.
      See Also:
      • A version of this method that takes a condition to finish the loop.

    • cmd

      public Command cmd(BooleanSupplier finishCondition)
      Creates a command that will poll this event loop and reset it when it is finished or canceled.
      Parameters:
      finishCondition - A condition that will finish the loop when it is true.
      Returns:
      A command that will poll this event loop and reset it when it is finished or canceled.
      See Also:
      • A version of this method that doesn't take a condition and never finishes.
